009package imagingbook.common.filter.examples;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
015import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
016import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * Example filter based on {@link GenericFilterVector} performing linear convolution with a custom 3x3 filter kernel.
022 * Typically used on RGB color images (with 3-element pixel vectors). Pixels in scalar-valued images are treated as
023 * 1-element vectors.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * Usage:
027 * </p>
028 * <pre>
029 * ImageProcessor ip = ...      // any image but typically a RGB color image
030 * GenericFilter filter = new ExampleFilter3x3Vector();
031 * filter.applyTo(ip);          // modifies ip
032 * </pre>
033 * <p>
034 * Note: This is merely a linear filter with a custom kernel to demonstrate the concept of a generic filter. In practice
035 * (depending on the type of kernel) this would be implemented as a sub-class of {@link LinearFilter} or
036 * {@link LinearFilterSeparable}, which is much more efficient.
037 * </p>
038 *
039 * @author WB
040 * @see LinearFilter
041 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
042 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)
043 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor, OutOfBoundsStrategy)
044 */
045public class ExampleFilter3x3Vector extends GenericFilterVector {
046
047        // custom (nonsymmetric) convolution kernel
048        private final static float[][] H = {
049                        {1, 8, 7},
050                        {2, 9, 6},
051                        {3, 4, 5}};
052        
053        private final static int width = H[0].length;                   // = 3
054        private final static int height = H.length;                             // = 3
055        private final static int xc = width / 2;                                // = 1
056        private final static int yc = height / 2;                               // = 1
057        private final static float s = (float) Matrix.sum(H);
058        
059        @Override
060        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) { // returns float[] pixel value
061                int depth = pack.getDepth();
062                float[] sum = new float[depth];
063                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
064                        int vj = v + j - yc;
065                        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
066                                int ui = u + i - xc;
067                                float[] p = pack.getPix(ui, vj);        // read float[] pixel value
068                                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
069                                        sum[k] = sum[k] + (p[k] * H[i][j]) / s;
070                                }
071                        }
072                }
073                return sum;
074        }
075
076}
